Module contents¶

class rec_room.recommenders.BaseRS(args, path)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Base class for all Recommender Systems

All Recommender Systems integrated into the Recommender Room must inherit from the BaseRS class to ensure the appropriate methods and properties are defined. The Rec Room will call the methods or use the properties at runtime.

abstract property dataset¶

return the dataset and labels

abstract property model¶

return the trained model

abstract recommend(args)¶

make a recommendation

abstract render()¶

return HTML

abstract visualize(args)¶

return config options for chart.js

class rec_room.recommenders.USCollegesRS(rs_args: Dict[str, str] = None, rs_dir: str = None)¶

Bases: rec_room.recommenders._base.BaseRS

The US Colleges Recommender System.

This RS outputs a university recommendation based on 3 criteria: gpa, gpa, and rank. A Nearest Neighbor model was trained to output university recommendations. The data used by this RS was obtained from:

  • https://www.kaggle.com/mylesoneill/world-university-rankings

  • https://www.kaggle.com/malapatiravi/graduate-school-admission-data/home

Parameters

  • rs_args (Dict) – User specified arguments for preferences or constraints

  • rs_dir (Str) – Directory to where the RS is located.

model¶

The trained model that has been loaded.

Type

sklearn.linear_model.NearestNeighbor

labels¶

The labels used by the model

Type

DataFrame

template¶

The filepath to the HTML that will populate the Parameters section in the Recommender page

Type

str

viz¶

The filepath to the JavaScript options that will be used to parameterize the chart.js library in the Recommender page

Type

str

requires¶

Metadata required to be captured in the Recommender page in order to make a recommendation

Type

Dict

dtypes¶

Specifies the appropriate data type for the evaluation criteria used by the RS

Type

Dict

META = {'dataset': 'us_colleges.csv', 'labels': 'us_colleges_labels.sav', 'model': 'us_colleges_model.sav', 'path': 'us_colleges_rs', 'template': 'us_colleges_render.html', 'visualize': 'us_colleges_results.yaml'}¶
property dataset¶

Return the US Colleges dataset.

property labels

Return the saved labels used by the Recommender System

property model

Return the saved model used by the Recommender System.

The US COlleges RS uses a Nearest Neighbor model from the scikit-learn libary with the following parameters:

NearestNeighbors(algorithm=’auto’, leaf_size=30, metric=’minkowski’,

metric_params=None, n_jobs=None, n_neighbors=161, p=2, radius=1.0)

recommend(args: Dict[str, str] = None) → Dict[str, str]¶

Make a Recommendation for US Colleges.

This function calls the pre-trained self.model and self.labels to make the best prediction, or recommendation, for the provided instance arguments.

Parameters

args (Dict) – User specified arguments for preferences or constraints

Returns

recs – The recommendation results

Return type

Dict

render() → str¶

Return the HTML to be rendered.

The HTML will be populated in the Parameters component of the Recommender page.

Returns

html – HTML text to be rendered by the browser

Return type

str

visualize(data: List[Dict]) → Dict[str, Dict]¶

Return the formatted options Dict for the chart.js library.

Parameters

data (list) – The arguments specified by the user to be formatted for plotting

Returns

js – The arguments that will be used to create the chart/plot on the Results section of the Recommender page.

Return type

dict

class rec_room.recommenders.OMSCoursesRS(rs_args: Dict[str, str] = None, rs_dir: str = None)¶

Bases: rec_room.recommenders._base.BaseRS

The OMS Courses Recommender System.

This RS outputs course recommendations based on 3 criteria: rating, difficulty, and workload. A Logistc Regression classifier was trained to output course recommendations. The data used by this RS was obtained from:

  • www.omscentral.com

Parameters

  • rs_args (Dict) – User specified arguments for preferences or constraints

  • rs_dir (Str) – Directory to where the RS is located.

model¶

The trained model that has been loaded.

Type

sklearn.linear_model.LogisticRegression

labels¶

The labels used by the model

Type

sklearn.preprocessing.LabelEncoder

template¶

The filepath to the HTML that will populate the Parameters section in the Recommender page

Type

str

viz¶

The filepath to the JavaScript options that will be used to parameterize the chart.js library in the Recommender page

Type

str

stats¶

Relevant statistical data from the RS’s dataset

Type

DataFrame

requires¶

Metadata required to be captured in the Recommender page in order to make a recommendation

Type

Dict

dtypes¶

Specifies the appropriate data type for the evaluation criteria used by the RS

Type

Dict

META = {'dataset': 'oms_courses.csv', 'labels': 'oms_courses_labels.sav', 'model': 'oms_courses_model.sav', 'path': 'oms_courses_rs', 'template': 'oms_courses_render.html', 'visualize': 'oms_courses_results.yaml'}¶
property dataset¶

Return the OMS Courses dataset.

property labels

Return the saved labels used by the Recommender System

property model

Return the saved model used by the Recommender System.

The OMS Course RS uses a logistic regression classifier from the scikit-learn library with the following parameters:

LogisticRegression(C=1.0, class_weight=None, dual=False,

fit_intercept=True, intercept_scaling=1, l1_ratio=None, max_iter=5000, multi_class=’auto’, n_jobs=None, penalty=’l2’, random_state=0, solver=’saga’, tol=0.0001, verbose=0, warm_start=False)
